title: Finding Bar Widths of Histograms
body: The following data are the shoe sizes of 50 male students. The sizes are discrete data since shoe size is measured in whole and half units only. Calculate the width of each bar or class interval. Suppose you choose six bars. \\n 9; 9; 9.5; 9.5; 10; 10; 10; 10; 10; 10; 10.5; 10.5; 10.5; 10.5; 10.5; 10.5; 10.5; 10.5 \\n 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11; 11.5; 11.5; 11.5; 11.5; 11.5; 11.5; 11.5 \\n 12; 12; 12; 12; 12; 12; 12; 12.5; 12.5; 12.5; 12.5; 14
lesson: 2.2 Histograms, Frequency Polygons, and Time Series Graphs
